snippet: More than 23,000 people, mostly children, have been infected with the disease in the Katanga region of the country.
abstract: More than 400 children have died in measles outbreak in Katanga region of Democratic Republic of Congo; Doctors Without Borders officials discuss difficulties in providing vaccinations in poor and war-torn area, but despite hazards have vaccinated more than 300,000 children.
lead_paragraph: More than 23,000 people, mostly children, have been infected with the disease in the Katanga region of the country.

headline.print_headline: 400 Die in Outbreak of Measles in Africa
headline.main: Measles Outbreak in Democratic Republic of Congo Kills 400
